body.p: I will make a note of the twenty fourth — and come if I can (of which I have aAdded over caret. little doubt) — and let you know beforehand.

Your pretty little protegéeThus in MS. The girl was put forward by Mrs Gibson for the post of matron of Urania Cottage (the home for homeless women established by CD), but was passed over on account of her youth and inexperience. See To Mrs Gibson, 26 October 1847 (Pilgrim Letters 5, p. 176). has played the Devil with us by her delay; but it was quite natural, and I can’t blame her.

closer.salute: Very faithfully Yours, Charles Dickens P.S. My love to the bright daughter.Alice Mary Milner Gibson.
